text: John Parrott MBE (born 11 May 1964 in Liverpool) is an English former professional snooker player. He became professional in 1983. He retired in 2010. He was in the top 16 of the world rankings for 14 years. He twice got to the final of the World Snooker Championship. At the 1989 World Snooker Championship, he lost 3â€“18 to Steve Davis. Two years later, he won the 1991 World Snooker Championship. He also won against White later the same year, to win the 1991 UK Championship. ==Other websites== * John Parrott Homepage Category:1964 births Category:Living people Category:Sportspeople from Liverpool Category:English snooker players
title: John Parrott
